Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a drab-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and red/mauve in section, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and very faint traces of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393430) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393430)
